sentences.english: Yeah, we must keep clear-headed, away from it.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我们应该保持清醒的头脑，拒绝艳遇。

sentences.english: An opportunity for a romance may arise which is likely to be exciting, though short-lived.
sentences.chinese: 很有可能是个激动人心的艳遇，尽管它很短暂。

sentences.english: Tom: But nowadays, many people desire to have some love affairs.
sentences.chinese: 但如今，很多人都渴望有些艳遇。

sentences.english: So of the husband make wife occurrence affairs of all rate consumedly exaltation.
sentences.chinese: 这样的丈夫使妻子发生艳遇的概率大大提高了。

sentences.english: I agree with you, maybe the aesthetic fatigue causes it.
sentences.chinese: 我同意，或许是审美疲劳引起艳遇吧。

sentences.english: Bob: Yeah, we must keep clear-headed, away from it.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我们应该保持清醒的头脑，拒绝艳遇。

sentences.english: But nowadays, many people desire to have some love affairs.
sentences.chinese: 但如今，很多人都渴望有些艳遇。

sentences.english: These mid-life affairs don't necessarily spell the end of a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 这样的中年艳遇不一定以婚姻为终点。

sentences.english: To my mind, as long as I could get married with jack, I did not care whether he had had some love affairs with other women.
sentences.chinese: 只要能和安杰结婚，他的艳遇，我可以隐忍。

definition: to meet by chance/to run into sb/chance encounter
to chase women/to express oneself in a pompous flowery style
(slang) to hook up for a one night stand/booty call
to hit on someone/to strike up a conversation/to start talking to end an awkward silence or embarrassing situation
wind, flower, snow and moon, trite poetry subject (idiom); effete language without substance/love affair/romance is in the air/dissipated life
to lose one's love/to break up (in a romantic relationship)/to feel jilted
